NOMAD

Livestreaming Visible Radio Platform For Secondhand Travel Experience
  • Individual Project
  • 2021.06 ~ 2021.08
  • UX Research, Ideation, UXUI Design, Interaction Design

  • link:

    survey questions, prototype
Problem

A heightened desire to go outside or to see even more of the world and feeling a connection with people during the Pandemic

Solution

Online Travel through a Stream of Livestreaming Videos, or Visual Radios, Easily Taken by Your Neighbours across the World

“ Anyone can be a tour guide, as any hometown can be a destination for travel. ”

Context.

During the Pandemic...

“I have been virtually traveling with Tinder passport.”
“I use Snapchat Maps for my travel.”

The Youths

Has Heightened Their Desire For Outside World,

Thereby Exploring Places Through Digital Maps

* excerpted from the virtual travel Youtube viewer’s comments

According to a global survey from Booking.com,

95%

look for vacation inspiration
when the pandemic hit

53%

heightened desire to see
even more of the world

51%

search vacation
inspiration online

Has Been Suffering From Depression & Loneliness

“Youth depression doubled during the pandemic”
“Young adults hardest hit by loneliness during pandemic”

* excerpted from CNN and Harvard Research

Youth were dealing with emotional stress from being stucked in rooms
and unable to make new friends or encounter new people.

Initial Survey

  • 69 survey participants
  • survey link

Prefer video to photo for online travel (62%)

Affirmative in introducing their cities / countries (77%)

Fear for Invasion of Privacy (64%) and Perceived Difficulty of Publicly Creating Travel Content (67%) Resulting in barely uploading a public account

Competitive Analysis

Based on the initial survey, I’ve selected five video platforms related to online travel or could be used for such purposes.

Tinder Passport

During Covid-19, Tinder temporarily freed charges for using the “Passport” feature, which offers the chance of users matching with other users across the world. This aims for “global dating,” nevertheless is used for travel among some users.

Snapchat Map

Snapchat’s 1st Depth function, “Map,” allows users to navigate the world, viewing stories made in specific regions made within 24 hours. It also allows users to see their friends’ current locations.

Africa TV

It is like a live-stream version of YouTube, made and being active in S.Korea. BJ’s face reveal is an implicit rule among the users.

Drive & Listen

Launched during covid-19, it is a website that runs for the sole purpose of online travel. Its central concept is driving a car in different cities.

Semi-Structured Interview

  • 5 interviews with whom use the competitors’ products
  • Duration: June 2021 (3 weeks)
  • interview link
Key Similarities

They wanted connectedness with the outside, not travel insights

They feared for becoming a content creator for its supposed difficulty

Key Frustrations

video content are either unpredictable or worn-out

Fear for invasion of privacy & unwanted communication

Predictability

Knowing in advance or feeling the upcoming event; Encountering unexpected and unenjoyable content can make the experience stressful and burdensome.

Privacy UX

When it comes to social media products, uploading personal content often results in the users being exposed to unwanted attention and contact unless the product company carefully deals with it.

Synthesis.

Jasmine

20yr-old college student

Toronto, Canada

Personality: outgoing, vehement, inquisitive, friendly

Jasmine graduated high school during the pandemic and is spending her freshman year without meeting any new friends. She could not plan to travel abroad with her new colleague friends, and she was pretty depressed for months. The pattern of escaping to social media to get out of the emotions nevertheless gets more depressed when she turns off her phone.

fequently used apps:

Snapchat, Instagram, Tinder

<<<<<<< HEAD ======= >>>>>>> b3c392678a0c7a84dcb29fb391ffd978dffb0c3f
Huan

24yr-old graphic designer

Singapore, Singapore

Personality: exploratory, imaginative, reserved, private

Huan loves to travel — at least until he encountered the turbulent Covid-19 era. He loves traveling while working. He also has a photograph Instagram account with 3k followers, where he posts photos taken while traveling. However, it is not an available option for now. He has been searching for ways to feel refreshed but hasn't found any.

fequently used apps:

Pinterest, Drive and Listen, Youtube

"I don't want to feel isolated anymore."

excerpted from Interviewee E

“I usually know how to handle myself,
but I’m yearning for refreshment.”

excerpted from Interviewee D

Journey mapping

Frustrations
  • Emotionally drained and feeling loneliness and depression
  • Getting unwanted attention from strangers on the Internet while exploring social media
Motivations
  • Feeling energetic again
  • Finding potential friends with a genuine connection
Jasmine's Daily Life
<<<<<<< HEAD ======= >>>>>>> b3c392678a0c7a84dcb29fb391ffd978dffb0c3f
Frustrations
  • Feeling lethargic and chocky
Motivations
  • Getting some refreshment
  • Exploring the next destination for travel for the near future
Huan's Daily Life

How Might We

Reduce negative feelings like loneliness, depression, boredom

&

Increase positive feelings by making them feel like traveling the world?

Design.

Although we cannot travel far from our hometown,
we can secondhand experience others' daily life and feel like traveling.
Watching and Listening others' live-streaming daily life visual radios will fulfill user needs.

User Needs
  • Users feel boredom as outdoor activities has been drastically reduced
  • Unpredictable video contents before clicking the content
  • Users fear the invasion of privacy and getting unwanted communication
  • Users conceive it challenging to create video content for anonymous public
  • Users fear unpredictability when the content is the opposite of expectation
Design Implications
  • Apply Gamification
  • Specify the Content Options
  • Minimize personal info requirement & Group communication than 1:1 chat
  • Lower the psychological burden of creating public video content
  • Apply predictable design system

Low-Fidelity Design

High-Fidelity GUI Design

Design Decisions

Decrease Click Counts for instant & constant communication while watching videos
  • For active interactions, video screens should be shown during writing own comments and viewing other comments.
  • Rather than hiding comments in a comment icon, the comments are shown directly to the user.
  • The button to write a comment is also directly shown.
Optimize Viewing preferences Easily

The menu bar contains specified viewing options and preferences that can be made while watching a video.

Visual Design

Logo Design

Overall Concept:

Video game & cartoon motivated design to give users joy

Symbol:

To symbolize the outside world, I simplified Earth and made it also look like a hill, which reminds people of artless childhood and playful colors.

Representative Color:

I picked vivid green which exhibits vehement and childlike personality. It also matches well with the overall concept.

Colors
